intro: Psidium australe var. argenteum, commonly known as the silverleaf guava, is a variant of the guava species native to Australia. It is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on the leaves, which give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its fruit is generally smaller than the common guava and has a more acidic flavor. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various climates.
